Question Text: What does the term "LLM" stand for in the context of AI?
Interpretation: Correct definition: AI trained on huge text datasets to understand and generate language
Resource Title: Generative AI and Large Language Models
Resource Description: Explains that Copilot is a large language model based AI that generates responses by predicting text based on patterns in its training data

Question Text: How do generative AI tools (like Copilot or ChatGPT) produce answers to your prompts?
Interpretation: Correct: details how generative AI relies on probability and training data patterns to generate language
Resource Description: Describes how AI models like Copilot use patterns from training data to generate text, rather than retrieving exact real-time facts

Question Text: In an enterprise setting, what information does an AI assistant use to answer your work-related questions?
Interpretation: Correct: AI uses your accessible emails, documents, chats, etc., along with its training data
Resource Description: Describes how Copilot accesses content and context through Microsoft Graph and combines it with LLM capabilities to generate relevant responses

Question Text: Why might AI-generated answers sometimes be incorrect or biased?
Interpretation: Correct: LLMs learn from data, which can contain biases and inaccuracies
Resource Description: Explains how gaps in training data and ambiguous prompts can cause AI hallucinations or inaccurate outputs

Question Text: How well do you understand how AI tools like generative models work?
Interpretation: Little or no understanding of AI concepts
Resource Description: Discusses how generative AI like Copilot can be used to assist with research and emphasizes understanding its features and limitations

Question Text: Which statement about AI tools and data access is true?
Interpretation: Correct: AI (e.g., Copilot) only uses data you already have access to
Resource Description: Explains that Copilot only surfaces organizational data for which the user has at least view permissions

Question Text: Which of the following is a good practice when using AI with sensitive data?
Interpretation: High maturity: uses authorized platforms and respects data sensitivity
Resource Title: Best Practices for Securing AI Tools
Resource Description: Advises reviewing security policies and using tools like Microsoft Purview to manage data access and retention

Question Text: A colleague wants to paste a confidential client report into a free public AI chatbot to get a summary. What do you do?
Interpretation: High maturity: ensures data security and compliance
Resource Title: Best Practices for Securing AI Tools
Resource Description: Highlights the importance of using approved tools and protecting sensitive data to avoid oversharing or compliance risks

Question Text: When using AI tools at work, how often do you ensure you’re following security and privacy guidelines (e.g., checking you’re not sharing restricted data)?

Question Text: What happens to the data and prompts you enter into enterprise AI tools (e.g., Copilot or other business AI services)?
Interpretation: Correct: data is stored within enterprise services and not used to train the foundation model
Resource Description: Explains that prompts and responses in Copilot are stored within Microsoft 365’s service boundary and not used to train the underlying models

Question Text: When AI tools provide citations or links with their answers, how often do you review those sources?
Interpretation: No verification: may trust AI outputs without checking references
Resource Description: Discusses the importance of evaluating AI outputs and cross-checking sources for accuracy and reliability

Question Text: In the context of AI, what is an "hallucination"?
Interpretation: Correct: a hallucination is when the AI’s response is plausible but factually wrong
Resource Description: Defines what an AI hallucination is and explains why these incorrect yet confident statements can occur

Question Text: An AI assistant provides a detailed answer with two citations. How do you ensure it is trustworthy?
Interpretation: High maturity: verifies source documents to ensure accuracy
Resource Description: Highlights the importance of checking and evaluating external sources recommended by AI for accuracy and relevance

Question Text: If an AI gives a confident-sounding answer without citations and you’re unsure it’s correct, what should you do?
Interpretation: High maturity: verify external sources or ask the AI to provide references
Resource Description: Suggests testing prompts and verifying information with external or multiple queries to ensure accuracy

Question Text: When you get content or analysis from an AI tool, how do you usually handle it?
Interpretation: No verification: high risk of errors if AI output is contextually inaccurate

Resource Description: Advises reviewing AI-generated content carefully and expecting variability in outputs, emphasizing the need for verification
